name: 探索建築—建築藝術概論
goals: Abilities in analysis of works of art and architecture and in gathering and exploring resources relative to art and architectural historical research.
Abilities in formulating and investigating special topics in art and architectural history.
Basic abilities to identify and analyze art works, buildings and monuments.
Abilities in practical applications of art and architectural history knowledge (to explain, to teach, to transmit, to write and to edit works in topics related to art history).
Esthetic sensitivity and concern for humanities.
Comprehension of cultural heritage conservation and preservation.
Global vision in cross-culture issues and international-exchange affairs and respect for the diversity and difference between arts and cultures.
syllabus:
Teaching Content (weekly):

**01**

Introduction to the course: What do architectural historians do? Methods and tools

**02**

Antiquity in Greece and Rome

**03**

The time of the great cathedrals in Europe

**04**

The buildings of NTNU Campus—Architecture for education

**05**

A time of great discoveries: Renaissance in Italy

**06**

Splendor and Power: The Baroque art of building

**07**

Classical architecture in Taipei

**08**

The 19th century—between Romanticism and Industrial Revolution

**09**

Between tradition and modernity: the early 20th century

**10**

From the 20th to the 21st century—Aspects of contemporary architecture

**11**

Guest lecture: N.N.

**12**

Guest lecture: N.N.

**13**

Guest lecture: The art of living together—History of urban collective housing in Taiwan (Lin Jin-An, Architect)

**14**

Guest lecture: N.N.

**15**

Guest lecture: N.N.

**16**

Preparing an architectural exhibition

**17**

Free time for learning

**18**

Written test

methodologies.note: Substantial part of the teaching: 1) Analysis and methods concerning artworks and their cultural, political, and economic backgrounds, and 2) Understanding the topic with practical examples (field visits).
Students are taught how to discuss together course contents, research topics and methodological approaches.
Field trips will be part of the course

grading.note: Homework: preparation of topics, weekly reading.
Discussion of art works and texts (original sources, secondary literature).
Weekly attendance at the course is required.
Short presentation with PowerPoint of a topic
Every student presents a topic (exhibition materials, own photographs)
Field trips (Taipei and other places in Taiwan)

prerequisite: ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
